availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Bailey Ausenbaugh (Caldwell co., ky, farmer, pvt. 10th ky cav (csa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jacob Ausenbaugh and Mary Ausenbaugh. Married to Sarah Ann French Ausenbaugh. Father of Sarah Elizabeth Ausenbaugh. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from November 21, 1862, to March 25, 1865. Captured at Cheshire, Ohio, on July 20, 1863. Imprisoned at Camp Douglass in Chicago, Illinois, from July 20, 1863, to March 25, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath the the United States on March 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 353B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 85.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #3991.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0056.
